intro: Varronia bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia varronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
